Mimo nakazu rozbiórki wydanego przez lokalne władze ignorował przepisy i dalej czerpał zyski z wynajmu. Sąd ukarał go grzywną i nakazał zwrot dochodów. Łączna kwota kary robi wrażenie.

Źródło Polskiej Agencji Prasowej w Brukseli podało, że głosowanie nad porozumieniem w komisji handlu międzynarodowego PE, planowane pierwotnie na koniec stycznia, nie dojdzie do skutku. W sprawie tej miała zapanować zgodność między najważniejszymi frakcjami.

articles.title: Ile kosztuje dolar? Kurs dolara do złotego PLN/USD 20.1.2026
articles.summary: Kurs dolara - 20.1.2026. We wtorek za jednego dolara (USD) trzeba zapłacić 3.60450 zł.

articles.title: Amazon threatens 'drastic' action after Saks bankruptcy, says $475M stake is now worthless
articles.summary: Amazon invested $475 million into Saks' acquisition of Neiman Marcus. It wants a federal judge to reject Saks' bankruptcy plan because it harms creditors.

articles.title: Goldman Sachs tops profit estimates as equities, asset and wealth management outperform
articles.summary: Goldman's revenue dipped 3% in Q4, which the company said was the result of off-loading the Apple Card loan portfolio to JPMorgan Chase.

articles.title: College students and teens could be fueling the prediction markets boom
articles.summary: Where sports betting is legal, it's often limited to those 21 years or older. Kalshi and Polymarket are open to anyone 18 or older, with some exceptions.

articles.title: Trump unveils health-care plan outline as Congress wrestles over Obamacare subsidies
articles.summary: Trump urged Congress, which is grappling over an extension of key ACA tax credits, to pass "The Great Healthcare Plan" without delay.

articles.title: How the Buffett family plans to give away more than $150 billion
articles.summary: In a rare interview, the three Buffett heirs said their world view, priorities and approach to philanthropy began in the Buffett household.

articles.title: NBCUniversal strategically leans into sports as it prepares for 'Legendary February'
articles.summary: NBCUniversal's calling card used to be "Must See TV," but the modern media world has pushed the company in a new direction, led by live sports.

articles.title: Billionaire Rams owner Stan Kroenke becomes America's biggest private landowner
articles.summary: Kroenke represents a growing wave of ultra-wealthy entrepreneurs investing in long-held ranches and farmland.

articles.title: How Saks' acquisition of Neiman Marcus plunged the company into bankruptcy: 'Recipe for disaster'
articles.summary: Saks used $2.2 billion in junk bonds to buy Neiman Marcus, but didn't have enough money left over to pay vendors, which led the company to declare bankruptcy.

articles.title: Under threat from Trump, Wall Street banks wager they can fend off credit card price controls
articles.summary: Five days after Trump's demand to cap credit card rates, bankers and lobbyists told CNBC they have yet to receive any formal or written guidance on the policy.

articles.title: Commercial real estate deal-making slows again in November
articles.summary: The multifamily sector saw the majority of November deals, recording 20 transactions, followed by office with 11 and industrial with eight.

articles.title: Disney dominated the 2025 box office. Here's how it could keep the crown in 2026
articles.summary: Disney accounted for 27.5% of the domestic box office's overall annual haul. It looks to be a dominant force in 2026, too.

articles.title: Stellantis stock off 43% as Jeep maker turns five, executes turnaround
articles.summary: Stellantis shares were largely up – as high as 93% in March 2024 – until reporting troubling financial results that year amid cost-cutting efforts and EVs.

articles.title: Novo Nordisk shares rise 8% after Wegovy obesity pill has 'solid' launch
articles.summary: The early data is a boost to the Danish drugmaker's hopes of winning back more market share from Eli Lilly in the obesity drug space.

articles.title: Hassett pivots to possible 'Trump cards' amid credit card interest rate battle with banks
articles.summary: Trump called for banks to cap credit card interest rates at 10%, an idea that has been roundly rejected by industry executives and their lobbyists this week.

articles.title: Stellantis CEO: 2026 is the ‘year of execution’ as Wall Street awaits turnaround strategy
articles.summary: Stellantis CEO Antonio Filosa views 2026 as an execution year for the embattled automaker following years of sales declines in the U.S.

articles.title: Trump's proposed ban on buying single-family homes introduces uncertainty for family offices
articles.summary: Wall Street landlords are the primary target of Trump's proposed ban, but investment firms of the ultra rich could get caught in the crosshairs.
